title: XM Cloud Fundamentals
executive_summary: XM Cloud is Sitecore's cloud-native, SaaS content management platform that provides a fully managed, scalable solution for digital experience management. Built on a headless architecture, it allows teams to use modern frontend frameworks while maintaining powerful content authoring capabilities.
learning_objectives: Understand XM Cloud architecture and its core components
Set up a development environment for XM Cloud projects
Build components using Sitecore JSS with React/Next.js
Implement field helpers for Experience Editor support
Deploy applications using XM Cloud Deploy

sections.title: What is XM Cloud?
sections.content: XM Cloud is Sitecore's cloud-native, SaaS content management platform representing a significant evolution in the Sitecore ecosystem.

sections.title: Benefits of XM Cloud
sections.content: XM Cloud offers numerous advantages over traditional CMS installations.

sections.title: Headless Architecture
sections.content: The content management backend is completely separated from the frontend presentation layer.
key_points: Use modern frameworks like React and Next.js

sections.title: Core Components
sections.content: XM Cloud consists of three main components working together.
key_points: Experience Edge: Global CDN with GraphQL APIs
Pages: Visual page builder for marketers

sections.title: Content Management
sections.content: The CM environment provides the backend where content authors create and manage content.

sections.title: Experience Edge
sections.content: A globally distributed CDN that serves content via APIs.

sections.title: Pages Editor
sections.content: Visual page builder enabling marketers to compose pages without developer intervention.

sections.title: Required Tools
sections.content: Several development tools are required for XM Cloud development.

sections.title: Project Initialization
sections.content: Create new projects using the official scaffolding tool.

sections.title: Starter Template
sections.content: The starter template provides everything needed to begin development.

sections.title: JSS Component Model
sections.content: Components are built using Sitecore JSS with React or Next.js.

sections.title: Basic Component Structure
sections.content: JSS components follow a consistent pattern.

sections.title: Field Helpers
sections.content: JSS provides helper components for different field types.

sections.title: Experience Editor Support
sections.content: Field helpers enable inline editing in Experience Editor.

sections.title: XM Cloud Deploy
sections.content: Cloud-based CI/CD solution for XM Cloud applications.

sections.title: Deployment Pipeline
sections.content: The deployment process is fully automated.

key_takeaways: XM Cloud is a cloud-native, headless CMS built for modern development
Three core components: Content Management, Experience Edge, and Pages
Development uses JSS SDK with React/Next.js
Field helpers are essential for Experience Editor support
XM Cloud Deploy provides automated CI/CD from GitHub
Content is delivered globally via Experience Edge CDN

glossary.definition: Sitecore's cloud-native, SaaS content management platform
A CMS architecture where the content management backend is decoupled from the frontend presentation layer
Sitecore JavaScript SDK - enables building Sitecore applications with JavaScript frameworks
Sitecore's globally distributed CDN that serves content via GraphQL and REST APIs
The backend authoring environment where content is created and managed
Visual page builder in XM Cloud for no-code page composition
Query language for APIs used by Experience Edge to deliver content
WYSIWYG editing interface allowing content authors to edit content inline
JSS components (Text, RichText, Image, etc.) that render Sitecore fields with editing support
Sitecore service that provides page layout and content data to JSS applications
A Sitecore item that maps to a frontend component
Cloud-based CI/CD solution for deploying XM Cloud applications
Content Delivery Network - distributed servers that cache content close to users
Software as a Service - cloud-based software delivery model

essential_commands.description: Create a new XM Cloud project
Start development server connected to Sitecore
